Description of incident: Horizon Lines has notified mariners who served on vessels operated by Horizon Lines that a device containing their personal information has been identified as missing. The device was first identified as potentially missing on or about December 7, 2015 and appears to have been lost between November 9 and December 7, 2015.  The device contained individualized information of mariners who have served aboard vessels operated by Horizon Lines since the year 2000.  The information compromised  included names, birth dates, addresses, telephone numbers, emergency contact information, Social Security numbers, and in some cases bank account and routing numbers, photocopies of passports, Transportation Worker Identification Credentials (TWIC), Merchant Mariner Documents (MMD) and Merchant Mariner Credentials (MMC), and copies of specific medical documents.The company is offering AllClear ID for up to 12 months at no cost. For those affected call 1-855-711-5990.More information: http://oag.ca.gov/ecrime/databreach/reports/sb24-59399
